explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of modified genetic programming (MGP) and back-propagation neural network (BPN) for behavior scoring, which are machine learning techniques.
explanations.supervised learning: The behavior scoring problem involves forecasting future credit performance, which is a supervised learning task as it uses labeled data for classification.
explanations.classification: The paper explicitly mentions classification accuracy as a metric for evaluating the performance of the proposed method.
explanations.neural network: The paper compares the proposed MGP method with a back-propagation neural network (BPN).
explanations.backpropagation: The paper mentions back-propagation neural network (BPN) as one of the compared methods.
explanations.BP: BP is an abbreviation for back-propagation, which is mentioned in the context of the back-propagation neural network (BPN).
